title: DATS treatment schema
description: Process, part of a study, consisting in exposing participants to the study to different conditions or group those participants into different categories based on specific criteria and compare their outcomes

name.description: The name of the activity, usually one sentece or short description of the treatment.

description.description: A textual narrative comprised of one or more statements describing the treatment.

startDate.description: A timestamp to record the starting point of the activity.

endDate.description: A timestamp to record the end point of the activity.

dates.description: Relevant dates for the datasets, a date must be added, e.g. creation date or last modification date should be added.

duration.description: The time during which the activity takes place.

location.description: The location where the activity takes place.

performedBy.description: The person(s) or organisation(s) responsible for executing the process.

keywords.description: Tags associated with the activity, which will help in its discovery.

output.description: The entities resulting from applying the activity.

agent.description: The nature of the perturbation or intervention used in the treatment.

intensity.description: A measurement about how acute the perturbation is.

concomitance.description: A boolean value to indicate if more that one perturbations are applied at the same time to the same subject.

order.description: The rank in which perturbations are being applied to study subjects.

extraProperties.description: Extra properties that do not fit in the previous specified attributes.
